children.name: Surprised
Startled
Shocked
children.description: cause (someone) to feel surprised and upset.

children.name: Dismayed
children.description: cause (someone) to feel consternation and distress.
feeling or showing sudden shock or alarm.

children.name: Confused
Disillusioned
children.description: disappointed in someone or something that one discovers to be less good than one had believed.

children.name: Perplexed
children.description: completely baffled; very puzzled.
(of a person) unable to think clearly; bewildered.

children.name: Amazed
Astonished
children.description: greatly surprised or impressed; amazed.

children.name: Awe
children.description: a feeling of reverential respect mixed with fear or wonder.
greatly surprised; astonished.

children.name: Excited
Eager
children.description: (of a person) wanting to do or have something very much.

children.name: Energetic
children.description: showing or involving great activity or vitality.
very enthusiastic and eager.
feeling or showing surprise.

children.name: Happy
Playful
Aroused
children.description: evoke or awaken (a feeling, emotion, or response).

children.name: Cheeky
children.description: impudent or irreverent, typically in an endearing or amusing way.
fond of games and amusement; lighthearted.

children.name: Content
Free
children.description: not under the control or in the power of another; able to act or be done as one wishes.

children.name: Joyful
children.description: feeling, expressing, or causing great pleasure and happiness.
in a state of peaceful happiness.

children.name: Interested
Curious
children.description: eager to know or learn something.

children.name: Inquisitive
children.description: curious or inquiring.
showing curiosity or concern about something or someone; having a feeling of interest.

children.name: Proud
Successful
children.description: accomplishing an aim or purpose.

children.name: Confident
children.description: feeling or showing confidence in oneself; self-assured.
feeling deep pleasure or satisfaction as a result of one's own achievements, qualities, or possessions or those of someone with whom one is closely associated.

children.name: Accepted
Respected
children.description: admire (someone or something) deeply, as a result of their abilities, qualities, or achievements.

children.name: Valued
children.description: considered to be important or beneficial; cherished.
generally believed or recognized to be valid or correct.

children.name: Powerful
Courageous
children.description: not deterred by danger or pain; brave.

children.name: Creative
children.description: relating to or involving the imagination or original ideas, especially in the production of an artistic work.
having great power or strength.

children.name: Peaceful
Loving
children.description: feeling or showing love or great care.

children.name: Thankful
children.description: pleased and relieved.
free from disturbance; tranquil.

children.name: Trusting
Sensitive
children.description: quick to detect or respond to slight changes, signals, or influences.

children.name: Intimate
children.description: closely acquainted; familiar, close.
showing or tending to have a belief in a person's honesty or sincerity; not suspicious.

children.name: Optimistic
Hopeful
children.description: feeling or inspiring optimism about a future event.

children.name: Inspired
children.description: of extraordinary quality, as if arising from some external creative impulse.
hopeful and confident about the future.
feeling or showing pleasure or contentment.

children.name: Sad
Lonely
Isolated
children.description: ar away from other places, buildings, or people; remote.

children.name: Abandoned
children.description: having been deserted or cast off.
sad because one has no friends or company.

children.name: Vulnerable
Victimized
children.description: single (someone) out for cruel or unjust treatment.

children.name: Fragile
children.description: (of an object) easily broken or damaged.
susceptible to physical or emotional attack or harm.

children.name: Despair
Grief
children.description: deep sorrow, especially that caused by someone's death.

children.name: Powerless
children.description: without ability, influence, or power.
the complete loss or absence of hope.

children.name: Guilty
Ashamed
children.description: embarrassed or guilty because of one's actions, characteristics, or associations.

children.name: Remorseful
children.description: filled with remorse; sorry.
culpable of or responsible for a specified wrongdoing.

children.name: Depressed
Empty
children.description: containing nothing; not filled or occupied.

children.name: Inferior
children.description: lower in rank, status, or quality.
(of a person) in a state of general unhappiness or despondency.

children.name: Hurt
Disappointed
children.description: (of a person) sad or displeased because someone or something has failed to fulfill one's hopes or expectations.

children.name: Embarrassed
children.description: feeling or showing embarrassment.
cause physical pain or injury to.
feeling or showing sorrow; unhappy.

children.name: Disgusted
Repelled
Hesitant
children.description: tentative, unsure, or slow in acting or speaking.

children.name: Horrified
children.description: filled with horror; extremely shocked.
drive or force (an attack or attacker) back or away.

children.name: Awful
Detestable
children.description: deserving intense dislike.

children.name: Nauseated
children.description: make (someone) feel sick; affect with nausea.
very bad or unpleasant.

children.name: Disappointed
Revolted
children.description: disgusted.

children.name: Appalled
children.description: greatly dismayed or horrified.
(of a person) sad or displeased because someone or something has failed to fulfill one's hopes or expectations.

children.name: Disapproving
Embarrassed
children.description: feeling or showing embarrassment.

children.name: Judgmental
children.description: of or concerning the use of judgment.
expressing an unfavorable opinion.
feeling or expressing revulsion or strong disapproval.

children.name: Anger
Critical
Dismissive
children.description: feeling or showing that something is unworthy of consideration.

children.name: Skeptical
children.description: not easily convinced; having doubts or reservations.
expressing adverse or disapproving comments or judgments.

children.name: Distant
Numb
children.description: deprived of the power of sensation.

children.name: Withdrawn
children.description: not wanting to communicate with other people.
far away in space or time.

children.name: Frustrated
Annoyed
children.description: slightly angry; irritated.

children.name: Infuriated
children.description: make (someone) extremely angry and impatient.
feeling or expressing distress and annoyance, especially because of inability to change or achieve something.

children.name: Aggressive
Hostile
children.description: unfriendly; antagonistic.

children.name: Provoked
children.description: stimulate or give rise to (a reaction or emotion, typically a strong or unwelcome one) in someone.
ready or likely to attack or confront; characterized by or resulting from aggression.

children.name: Mad
Jealous
children.description: feeling or showing envy of someone or their achievements and advantages.

children.name: Furious
children.description: extremely angry.
very angry.

children.name: Bitter
Violated
children.description: break or fail to comply with (a rule or formal agreement).

children.name: Indignant
children.description: feeling or showing anger or annoyance at what is perceived as unfair treatment.
having a sharp, pungent taste or smell; not sweet.

children.name: Humiliated
Ridiculed
children.description: subject (someone or something) to contemptuous and dismissive language or behavior.

children.name: Disrespected
children.description: show a lack of respect for; insult.
make (someone) feel ashamed and foolish by injuring their dignity and self-respect, especially publicly.

children.name: Let down
Resentful
children.description: feeling or expressing bitterness or indignation at having been treated unfairly.

children.name: Betrayed
children.description: expose (one's country, a group, or a person) to danger by treacherously giving information to an enemy.
fail to support or help someone as they had hoped or expected.
a strong feeling of annoyance, displeasure, or hostility.

children.name: Fearful
Threatened
Exposed
children.description: not covered or hidden; visible.

children.name: Nervous
children.description: easily agitated or alarmed; tending to be anxious; highly strung.
state one's intention to take hostile action against someone in retribution for something done or not done.

children.name: Rejected
Persecuted
children.description: subject (someone) to hostility and ill-treatment, especially because of their race or political or religious beliefs.

children.name: Excluded
children.description: deny (someone) access to or bar (someone) from a place, group, or privilege.
dismiss as inadequate, inappropriate, or not to one's taste.

children.name: Weak
Insignificant
children.description: too small or unimportant to be worth consideration.

children.name: Worthless
children.description: having no real value or use.
lacking the power to perform physically demanding tasks; lacking physical strength and energy.

children.name: Insecure
Inferior
children.description: lower in rank, status, or quality.

children.name: Inadequate
children.description: lacking the quality or quantity required; insufficient for a purpose.
not firmly fixed; liable to give way or break.

children.name: Anxious
Worried
children.description: anxious or troubled about actual or potential problems.

children.name: Overwhelmed
children.description: bury or drown beneath a huge mass.
experiencing worry, unease, or nervousness, typically about an imminent event or something with an uncertain outcome.

children.name: Scared
Frightened
children.description: afraid or anxious.

children.name: Helpless
children.description: unable to defend oneself or to act without help.
fearful; frightened.
feeling afraid; showing fear or anxiety.

children.name: Bad
Bored
Indifferent
children.description: having no particular interest or sympathy; unconcerned.

children.name: Apathetic
children.description: showing or feeling no interest, enthusiasm, or concern.
feeling weary because one is unoccupied or lacks interest in one's current activity.

children.name: Busy
Pressured
children.description: attempt to persuade or coerce (someone) into doing something.

children.name: Rushed
children.description: done or completed too hurriedly; hasty.
having a great deal to do.

children.name: Stressed
Overwhelmed
children.description: bury or drown beneath a huge mass.

children.name: Out of Control
children.description: no longer possible to manage.
experiencing mental or emotional strain or tension.

children.name: Tired
Sleepy
children.description: needing or ready for sleep.

children.name: Unfocused
children.description: (of a person or their eyes) not seeing clearly; appearing glazed or expressionless.
in need of sleep or rest; weary.
of poor quality or a low standard.
